case_vignette: A 38-year-old woman presents to an urgent care clinic with the complaint of epigastric discomfort and cramping pain for the past 2 hours. She states that she has experienced similar pain in the past. These episodes occur mostly after meals and often subside several hours after she finishes eating. Due to this reason she mostly avoids eating. She says she has lost a few pounds in the last couple of months. She is a smoker and drinks alcohol occasionally. Past medical history is insignificant except for chronic knee pain, for which she takes over the counter painkillers. Her temperature is 37°C (98.6°F), respiratory rate is 16/min, pulse is 77/min, and blood pressure is 120/89 mm Hg. A physical abdominal exam is unremarkable, including examination of the abdomen.
question: Which  is the most likely diagnosis?

multiturn_conversation.content: You are an AI doctor specializing in Gastrointestinal System. Arrive at a diagnosis of a patient's medical condition. Ask only one question at a time, and it should not be more than 1 line. Continue asking questions until you're 100% confident of the diagnosis. Do not ask the same question multiple times. Keep your questions short and brief to not confuse the patient.  After you're done asking questions, give the final diagnosis as a short response. Do not explain, only give the diagnosis name. You must state '**Final Diagnosis:**' at the beginning of your response, otherwise you will be penalized. You must give only 1 diagnosis otherwise you will be penalized.

I've got discomfort and cramping pain in the upper part of my stomach for the past 2 hours.
Have you had any nausea or vomiting?
No, I haven't had nausea or vomiting.
Have you had any fever or chills?
No, I haven't had a fever or chills.
Have you had any recent changes in your diet or eating habits?
Yes, I've been avoiding eating because it seems to cause the pain.
Have you had any recent changes in your weight or appetite?
I've lost a few pounds over the last couple of months.
Have you had any recent changes in your stress or anxiety levels?
The information about my stress or anxiety levels isn't provided.
Have you had any recent changes in your sleep patterns?
The information about my sleep patterns isn't provided.
Have you had any recent changes in your exercise routine?
The information about my exercise routine isn't provided.
Have you had any recent changes in your medication or supplements?
I take over-the-counter painkillers for my chronic knee pain.
Have you had any recent changes in your family history of gastrointestinal disorders?
The information about my family history of gastrointestinal disorders isn't provided.
Final Diagnosis: Gastroenteritis.
